column4: I just installed Ubuntu Desktop 12.04.1 LTS 64 bit. How can I know which video driver uses my X Window system?
I want to use nouveau but I suspect that that my system uses nvidia driver.
lsmod will show what driver is loaded
Thanks! I know it now: nvidia 8107594  34
no  worries :)
open additional drivers and disable the nvidia driver then reboot
How can I open additional drivers?
you're in unity? press the super key (windows logo) and type drivers
I'm in Unity.
I get not any application.
are you spelling driver right?
Yes: driver
what ubuntu are you running?
I'm running Ubuntu Desktop 12.04.1 LTS 64 bit.
it should work, oh well, open a terminal and type gksudo jockey-gtk
I started the jockey-gtk successfully.
disable the nvidia driver from there then
So now I disabled the nvidia driver. Should I relogin, or should I restart the X Window , but how can do that here in Ubuntu?
simpler to reboot
OK
Thank you!
